### Gitian builds | File | commit 63952f73b3041468fe3b25fa54858db7899273fa
(master) | commit 7dc831a914e93fc617a7b6ea5fe2c3505a3d5743
(master and this pull) | |--|--|--| | *-aarch64-linux-gnu-debug.tar.gz | [`5484237ee5c3fa99...`](https://drahtbot.space/gitian/bitcoin/bitcoin/63952f73b3041468fe3b25fa54858db7899273fa/bitcoin-63952f73b304-aarch64-l
I'm confused by this comment as it contradicts the [one](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=90458#c4) from bugzilla:\n> ... Windows has been doing stack clash protection since day `#1`

How does it contradict it? The two Bugzilla comments say that Windows has it's own mechanisms to handle this (and has done since day #1), hence the `-fstack-clash-protection` option would seem pointless, and should either be a NOP, or potentially throw an error when being applied to Windows builds.
Re-reading again. That makes sense now.
